definition: to separate/to partition/to stand or lie between/at a distance from/after or at an interval of
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: The next day the interrogators asked me about all the things we three had been speaking about in the cell.
sentences.chinese: 隔日审问者问我们三个人昨天在牢房说了些什么。

sentences.english: I brought the old and the new versions of the book back the next day before noon.
sentences.chinese: 隔日中午前，我把本子的新旧版本带回去给他。

sentences.english: And our content sheds Shanghai to also can accomplish major order tertian service.
sentences.chinese: 而上海我们的物流也可以做到大部分订单隔日送达。

sentences.english: You should have acupuncture every other day. Sleep on a hard bed and rest well.
sentences.chinese: 此外，您要隔日来针刺一次，睡硬板床，好好休息。

sentences.english: The next day MF disclosed a quarterly loss.
sentences.chinese: 隔日，MF市值损失四分之一。

sentences.english: He comes here on alternate days.
Snapshot update every other day, in fact, it does not mean your site how high the weight.
sentences.chinese: 快照隔日更新，其实这并不代表你的网站权重有多高。

sentences.english: Tom and Harry do the work on alternate days.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆和哈里隔日轮流做这工作。

sentences.english: He and I clean our room on alternate days.
sentences.chinese: 我和他隔日轮流打扫我们的房间。

definition: in a few days/one of these days
to continue to fall (of share prices)
many-headed/many-layered (authority)/devolved (as opposed to centralized)/pluralistic/(as classifier) number of animals/long term (finance)/long (investment)
